org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster

Class AbstractClusterer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster.AbstractClusterer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, Clusterer, ConditionsListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CTPClusterer, GTPClusterer, GTPOnlineClusterer, LegacyClusterer, NearestNeighborClusterer, ReconClusterer, SimpleCosmicClusterer, SimpleReconClusterer

    public abstract class AbstractClusterer
extends Object
implements Clusterer
    This is an abstract class that Clusterer classes should implement to perform a clustering algorithm on a CalorimeterHit collection. The sub-class should implement createClusters(EventHeader, List) which is the method that should perform the clustering algorithm.
    See Also:
    Clusterer, Cluster

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractClusterer

        AbstractClusterer(String[] cutNames,
                  double[] defaultCuts)
        Default constructor which takes names of cuts and their default values. These arguments cannot be null. (Instead use the no-arg constructor.)
        Parameters:
        cutNames - The names of the cuts for this clustering algorithm.
        defaultCuts - The default cut values for the algorithm matching the cutNames ordering.

      • AbstractClusterer

        AbstractClusterer(NumericalCuts cuts)
        Constructor with cuts set.
        Parameters:
        cuts - The numerical cuts.

        Default no-arg constructor.

        public void initialize()
        By default nothing is done in this method, but start of job initialization can happen here like reading cut settings into instance variables for convenience. This is called in the startOfData method of ClusterDriver.
